text:
I am facing the problem using Ant tool. I have got this ant tool from java 
webservices development pack. It was working fine for past two days. now 
whenever I start Apache Tomcat and then I use this ant, it gives me this 
application error message.
"The instruction at "0x780118f2" referenced memory at "0x443b7261". The memory 
could not be read.
Click OK to terminate the program.
click on Cancel to debug the program.

I dont know where is the error. I tried to uninstall java webservices tool kit. 
But I couldnt uninstall it.
I am using windows 2000 server.
Kindly help
thanks in advance
s.arun prasath
creator: arunprasath.s@polaris.co.in

text:
Given the jwsdp came from sun, and they produced their own builds of everything
and packaged it together, you should really be directing your support calls to
them. Really: the version of ant that they ship is a special build of ant1.4
that nobody on this team had anything to do with.

I uninstalled the jwsdp and did not have any problems doing so, even during the
beta program. Try again from the control panel:add/remove programs. If you cant.
again, take it up with Sun.
creator: stevel@apache.org
patrick.luby@planamesa.com
text:
I have some familiarity with JWSDP and, from your errors, it sounds like the
Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is having problems. When you get errors like "The
instruction at "0x780118f2" referenced memory at "0x443b7261", they usually mean
that the JVM is crashing. I don't believe that this is an Ant problem as there
is no native C code in JWSDP.

Since this worked for 2 days, the obvious question is did you reboot your
machine? Windows is known for its lack of stability and many applications don't
work right after Windows has been running continuously. Also, have you installed
or uninstalled other applications that may have tweaked your Java installation?

Lastly, if none of the above works, delete your entire JWSDP installation,
reboot your machine, and reinstall JWSDP. It is true that JWSDP can be
uninstalled using the Windows Add/Remove Programs panel, but the uninstaller is
written in Java. So, if Java is crashing, you will be stuck.

Thank you for replying.
Patrick, yes I rebooted windows machine and only after that this error is 
occuring. I have tried to uninstall java webservices tool kit. but I couldnt. 
so I deleted the folders and cleaned the registry using regcleaner. and I 
rebooted the machine and installed freshly again java webservices tool kit. 
even then this error occurs. ant works properly before starting the tomcat that 
comes along with java webservices tool kit. but error occurs in javaw.exe only 
when I start the tomcat.kindly help.
 thanks in advance for ur suggestions.
s.arun prasath
creator: arunprasath.s@polaris.co.in
stevel@apache.org
text:
1. this is probably not an ant bug. You keep talking about tomcat, and
tomcat!=ant. So perhaps you should change the product flag in the bugrep to be
tomcat.


2. if there are jwsdp problems, take them up with the supplier, who in this case
is sun. there may be a lot of apache stuff in there, but they took it and made
changes, changes we dont know about, so cant field problems.

3. the next escalation step is to uninstall and reinstall java. Get the latest
release version that works with jwsdp, which is 1.4.01

4. if that doesnt work, start worrying about the OS and hardware, specifically
memory. If DRAM is playing up, it can sometimes surface in code this way.
